title: For Sale/Trade:  Thompson 1927 A5 lightweight ~ RARE ~ W/ DRUMS!
postcontent:
Up for grabs is this super rare Thompson A5 light weight. This is was made in West Hurrley New York back in 1975 by Auto Ordinance, this is not a piece of junk Kahr. This has the aluminum receiver, there were 2000 made and that was all and this one has an odd 3 digit serial number. This one features a 13” barrel and foregrip, it is not classified as a AOW as it is over 26” long and has no way to attach a butt stock. If you know anything about these guns you just how rare it is. 
This one comes with (6) 32rd stick mags and (2) 50rd Auto Ordinance drums which are rare as well. This also comes with an Auto Ordinance soft bag.

I am firm at $2200 for the setup, this is cheap considering the rarity of the pistol and drums. I prefer trades and will consider all reasonable offers.

FTF in the Greater Tampa Bay Area, will ship to buyer's FFL on the buyer's dime. I require a FL DL and CWP. No felons, crazies or anyone else that cannot lawfully own a firearm. Thanks for looking and have a great day!

title: For Sale:  Springfield Armory XD40 Subcompact Bi-tone Stainless
postcontent:
I love this pistol but sadly have to downsize.  Handles great and just a few hundred rounds through it w/o any problems.  Solid feel and I think the most clever safety design in any pistol.  Not a problem to carry locked & loaded b/c the locks always on.  You will not shoot anything you are not trying to shoot. Period.  Check out the website for all the details on the design features if you aren't familiar with it.

http://www.springfield-armory.com/xd.php?version=66

This is the upgraded version with the stainless steel slide, not the basic one so it's more expensive retail.  Comes with two mags and a Pearson grip pinky extender on the short mag, modified Hogue anatomic grip (rubber & removable) .  Complete kit as shown on the site: holster, 2 mag holster, loader, lock, plastic case.  All original paperwork.

***Comes with Laserlyte rear sight laser*** I'm not crazy about this laser but it's on there and works.  I'm not adding anything to the price for the laser.  The original 3 dot sight is included if you want to re-install it (brass punch included).  I will say that the laser could use some new windage/elevation screws (very tiny and so small the allen wrench barely grips and no torque), not very easy to sight in.  The screws are available from Laserlyte.  It's yours to do with what you want.  Personally, if I were keeping the pistol I'd go ahead and splurge to get a green rail laser or Crimson Trace grip laser.   So...no complaints about the laser.  It's yours to resell if you don't like it.  

See info here:

http://www.laserlyte.com/products/rtb-xd

As seen in the pics; practice ammo included but shipped separately.  Approximately 400+ rounds.

For the nitty gritty.  I will ONLY use an FFL to sell/transact through. NO FTF W/O FFL. Period.   If I'm shipping then it's $28 for shipping from my FFL to your FFL. You can fax/email/mail your FFL info straight to mine.  If local then then I'll pay my FFL transfer fee and you can p/u from my FFL.   I'll ship the ammo separately by UPS and I'll pay shipping.   I'll give you the number, etc., after payment clears.  

I have references available if you are leary about internet classifieds.   

I will accept CC#, money order, certified check and cash.  That's it.  Credit card MUST be in the same name as buyer, no exceptions.  You can text/email/call your CC# to me.  I'll need CC# & CCV#, Exp date. 

$425 for all (plus shipping if shipped $458)  FIRST PAYER GETS IT---NO HOLDS.  

Add it up and that's $160+ bucks for ammo.  You are going to have to buy ammo anyway and that makes the pistol just $265!  If you end up liking the Lazerlyte laser that's $154 retail and drops the price to $111 for the pistol.  If you can't see the deal here I give up and will gladly keep this gun and just hide it from the Mrs.'s

title: For Sale:  Ithaca imported SKB 500 20 gauge
postcontent:
ITHACA imported and marked SKB 500 20 gauge O/U shotgun. This is WELL used and has been cut down for kids. I did this for my Grandchildren and loaded a reduced 3/4 oz. load for very mild recoil. Most of them are now taller than I am so it is no longer needed.

Obviously, with the barrels cut off, (the lower one had been damaged and I cut it off behind the damage), there is no choke but at the ranges that the blue rock were shot, it was not an issue. In fact, it helped them hit better because of the spread of the pattern.

The ejectors eject the shell about half the time because of weak springs but reliably extracts.

title: For Sale/Trade:  50 BMG Barrett with Extras!! - Deal Sweetened**
postcontent:
FS/FT – Barrett 50 BMG Package with Ammo and Accessories
Everything you need to get started!!!!



Barrett Model 99 package which includes Pelican Hard Case, Barrett Rings and Bushnell Tactical Scope.



[b]From Barrett:[/b]
Rugged. Reliable. Uncomplicated. The Model 99 is designed for one thing only: to get the job done. With its brilliantly simple design, hard-core construction and surprisingly few moving parts, it offers match-winning accuracy time and time again.

At the heart of this robust and accurate bolt action rifle is a one-piece 7000 series aluminum alloy extrusion. A heat-treated steel M1913 optics rail is attached to the top of the extrusion by closely spaced high-strength bolts. The match-toleranced barrel is pressed and locked into the receiver, creating a rock-solid unitized structure on which to mount a riflescope. The Model 99 barrel is made in a heavier contour to ensure repeatable accuracy. The chamber area is encased by the thick-walled aluminum extrusion of the receiver, resulting in unparalleled safety for the shooter.

The bolt is machined from a single piece of shock-resistant tool steel. The action’s strength is exemplified by the 15 bolt lugs that lock into the machined barrel extension. The bolt’s few moving parts, an extractor, ejector and firing pin assembly, make it reliable and easy to maintain.

The Model 99 is easily disassembled without tools by removing three quick-release assembly pins. These pins attach the trigger housing and bolt guide to the receiver assembly. The match-quality trigger design is exclusive to Barrett and virtually maintenance-free. The bipod can easily be detached for benchrest shooting.

Known as much for its dependability as its versatility, the Model 99 combines smooth functionality with dead-on accuracy, shot after shot.

This is a 1930 Mosin Nagant 91/30, Tula armory mfg, with the hex reciever.  The bore is so so nice.   Number are force-matched.  I stripped the stock and sprayed it desert tan with a super high quality, hard-wearing conversion varnish.  I added a rubber butt-pad.  The scope is an NCStar pistolero scope, with red reticle illumination.  It is a Long eye relief scope mounted on the rear sight dovetail in a rock solid 3 screw Leapers scope mount.  It does not move at all, totally in place.  Screws are blue threadlocked.   The 320 rnds of ammo are Russian steel core surplus.  

If you are looking for a mosin, you'll never find another deal like this.  You may find a cheaper mosin, but it will not be a Tula Hex, it won't have a near pefect bore and it wont have all these extras.  
I love this gun, I just have to sell a lot fo my toys because work is getting sparse.   Call Leighton at REDACTED.  I am firm on the price.  Please, don't even ask.

Caliber: 9x19 Luger
Length: 6.85"
Height: 4.61"
Weight: 23 oz. (Unloaded)
Barrel Length: 3.5"
Capacity: 10+1 or 17+1

Description: For sale is a lightly used Ruger SR9c that I bought new in late September 2011. I have the original receipt and the original box with the spent casing, manual, mag loader, three magazines, and magazine base plate (everything that came with it). I have a spare 10 round magazine that I bought for it ($40) that will be included, so a total of 3 magazines. Two of the magazines are the standard 10 round mags and one magazine is a 17 round magazine with a sleeve extension to make it a full size SR9 grip with the full size capacity (great for range shooting or home defense). The gun does have a manual thumb safety as well as a trigger safety, mag disconnect, and loaded chamber indicator.

I carried this gun only a handful of times and it is quite comfortable. It is also just big enough to be enjoyable at the shooting range. This gun is the perfect all around 9mm for range shooting, home defense, or concealed carry. I have babied this gun and it is in VERY good condition. I love this gun and it functions perfectly, but my Glock 26 has taken over for carry duty and I want a full size/full length target gun so I don't have a use for the SR9c anymore. I will miss it though. I would not sell this gun if it had any issues or flaws.

Buyer must have a permit to purchase or a concealed weapons permit (not legally necessary but I would prefer either of these).
